response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "low", "At 21, the individual is considered young, which does not inherently increase recidivism risk."],
    ["Gender", "low", "Females statistically tend to have lower recidivism rates relative to males."],
    ["Criminal History", "medium", "Although there is only one arrest with no conviction, any interaction with the system can be a moderate risk indicator."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Recent marijuana use presents a moderate risk factor, as substance use may be linked with other behavioral risks."],
    ["Mental Health", "medium", "Experiencing depressive symptoms—feeling down frequently—can impair decision-making and slightly elevate risk."],
    ["Social/Family Support", "low", "Being married and living with a spouse is generally a protective factor that reduces recidivism risk."],
    ["Education", "low", "Holding a high school diploma provides basic educational attainment, which is a protective factor compared to lower educational levels."],
    ["Employment", "medium", "Having only one job in the past year may suggest some instability in routine, marking a moderate risk factor."],
    ["Childhood/Household Background", "medium", "Growing up in a small urban household may introduce moderate risk exposures common in urban settings."],
    ["Spirituality", "low", "Belief in a divine influence can be associated with personal accountability and serves as a protective factor."]
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: At 21, the individual is considered young, which does not inherently increase recidivism risk.
Females statistically tend to have lower recidivism rates relative to males.
Although there is only one arrest with no conviction, any interaction with the system can be a moderate risk indicator.
Recent marijuana use presents a moderate risk factor, as substance use may be linked with other behavioral risks.
Experiencing depressive symptoms—feeling down frequently—can impair decision-making and slightly elevate risk.
Being married and living with a spouse is generally a protective factor that reduces recidivism risk.
Holding a high school diploma provides basic educational attainment, which is a protective factor compared to lower educational levels.
Having only one job in the past year may suggest some instability in routine, marking a moderate risk factor.
Growing up in a small urban household may introduce moderate risk exposures common in urban settings.
Belief in a divine influence can be associated with personal accountability and serves as a protective factor.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old female who identifies herself as White. She has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. She is 5 feet 8 inches and weighs 165 lbs. She is married and is currently living with her spouse. She has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. She has held 1 job during the year. She has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month she has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer her up. At a young age, she lived with her biological mother in a household of size 3, in an urban area. She considers that God has something to do with what happens to her personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
